result.execSummary:
The defendant Shanona Renee Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shanona Renee Davis in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 3 and 4:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED but read-in for purposes of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. 
As to Count 3:  Court ordered defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, with huber for work and school.  COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on 
Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months. 

As to Count 4:  Court ordered defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1, with huber for work and school.  COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on 
Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Defendant to serve 45 in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent.
-AODA assessment and treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drug or alcohol.
-Maintain full time employment or attend school.  
-Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
-No contact with Children's Place, Justice Store, Carters, Southridge Mall or co-actor Maurisha Hudson.
-Pay all applicable court costs during period of probation.  If not paid during probation, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at $0.
.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs during term of probation, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Shanona Renee Davis in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case held over form 8/20/2015. Defendant failed to appear during court session, appeared after court concluded. Defendant appeared this morning. Court called case. Court admonished defendant for late appearance, and vacated the stayed bench warrant. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at request of Defense Counsel.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT in court. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Defense requests court STAY a bench warrant for a Calendar Call date.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant issued, but STAYED for a calendar call date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Calendar call scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Shanona Renee Davis not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Defense counsel requests a plea/sentencing date.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shanona Renee Davis in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.46.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/28/15 @ 1:30pm
